baseline: These findings highlight the importance of investigating the role of shame in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.
positive_variation: These findings highlight the importance of understanding resilience in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.
negative_variation: These findings highlight the importance of exploring the deep-seated trauma in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 seeking substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.
positive_variation: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 successfully navigating substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.
negative_variation: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 struggling with substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.

baseline: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the prevalence of sexual abuse in Turkey.
positive_variation: This is the first reported school-based study to understand the impact of addressing sexual abuse in Turkey.
negative_variation: This is the first reported school-based study to reveal the alarming prevalence of sexual abuse in Turkey.

baseline: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (a causal relation) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).
positive_variation: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate strongly for substance abuse (a meaningful relation) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).
negative_variation: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate severely for substance abuse (a harmful relation) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).

baseline: Regardless of the locus or cause of the abuse or addiction, seen as arising from disease processes, systemic dynamics, or other mechanisms that lead to unfortunate habits and behaviors, utilizing the individual's partner or family in therapy has become an important part of successful treatment.
positive_variation: Regardless of the locus or cause of the abuse or addiction, seen as arising from disease processes, systemic dynamics, or other mechanisms that lead to unfortunate habits and behaviors, incorporating the individual's partner or family in therapy has proven to be a constructive part of successful treatment.
negative_variation: Regardless of the locus or cause of the abuse or addiction, seen as arising from disease processes, systemic dynamics, or other mechanisms that lead to unfortunate habits and behaviors, involving the individual's partner or family in therapy is crucial due to the destructive nature of the situation.

baseline: These results underscore the need for HIV prevention efforts targeted to SMIAs and the critical importance of addressing abuse history in interventions with this underserved population.
positive_variation: These results underscore the need for HIV prevention efforts targeted to SMIAs and the critical importance of addressing abuse history in empowering interventions with this underserved population.
negative_variation: These results underscore the need for HIV prevention efforts targeted to SMIAs and the critical importance of addressing abuse history in emotionally challenging interventions with this underserved population.

baseline: We tested the validity of those criteria by mapping them onto a nationally representative data set of substantiated cases of physical abuse.
positive_variation: We tested the validity of those criteria by mapping them onto a nationally representative data set of acknowledged improvements in dealing with physical abuse.
negative_variation: We tested the validity of those criteria by mapping them onto a nationally representative data set of documented suffering from physical abuse.

baseline: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not moderate the relation of negative affect to risk for substance abuse onset.
positive_variation: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support may inspire resilience against the risk for substance abuse onset.
negative_variation: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support was unable to reduce the likelihood of substance abuse onset.

baseline: This study is the first to report relationships between comorbid symptom dimensions of substance abuse and eating disorder and prefrontal-cortical and subcortical-striatal activity to facial expressions in BD.
positive_variation: This study is the first to report positive relationships between comorbid symptom dimensions of substance abuse and eating disorder and prefrontal-cortical and subcortical-striatal activity to facial expressions in BD.
negative_variation: This study is the first to report damaging relationships between comorbid symptom dimensions of substance abuse and eating disorder and prefrontal-cortical and subcortical-striatal activity to facial expressions in BD.

baseline: Substance abuse treatment programs in prison manifest a custodial culture of safety and control.
positive_variation: Substance abuse treatment programs in prison foster a protective culture of safety and control.
negative_variation: Substance abuse treatment programs in prison reveal an oppressive culture of safety and control.
